title: Unable to use cat on torch.LongTensor
body_html:
Hello again,

I'm trying to concatenate two tensor together using torch.cat applied on a Tensor that I have created from a Numpy array. Here is the example:

In [1]: import torch

In [2]: import numpy as np

In [3]: x = torch.LongTensor(np.random.randint(1, 20, (1, 1, 4)))

In [4]: torch.cat((x, torch.zeros(x.size())))
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-4ddca689077c> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat((x, torch.zeros(x.size())))

TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple), but expected one of:
 * (sequence[torch.LongTensor] seq)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple)
 * (sequence[torch.LongTensor] seq, int dim)

Instead if you try with this it works:

In [5]: a = torch.randn(1,1,4)

In [6]: a
Out[6]:

(0 ,.,.) =
 -1.1397  0.0766  1.3821 -0.4036
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1x1x4]

In [7]: torch.cat((a, torch.zeros(a.size())))
Out[7]:

(0 ,.,.) =
 -1.1397  0.0766  1.3821 -0.4036

(1 ,.,.) =
  0.0000  0.0000  0.0000  0.0000
[torch.FloatTensor of size 2x1x4]

What's wrong?

Cheers,
Alessandro

body:
Hello again,

I'm trying to concatenate two tensor together using `torch.cat` applied on a Tensor that I have created from a Numpy array. Here is the example:

```
In [1]: import torch

In [2]: import numpy as np

In [3]: x = torch.LongTensor(np.random.randint(1, 20, (1, 1, 4)))

In [4]: torch.cat((x, torch.zeros(x.size())))
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
TypeError                                 Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-4-4ddca689077c> in <module>()
----> 1 torch.cat((x, torch.zeros(x.size())))

TypeError: cat received an invalid combination of arguments - got (tuple), but expected one of:
 * (sequence[torch.LongTensor] seq)
      didn't match because some of the arguments have invalid types: (tuple)
 * (sequence[torch.LongTensor] seq, int dim)
```

Instead if you try with this it works:
```
In [5]: a = torch.randn(1,1,4)

In [6]: a
Out[6]:

(0 ,.,.) =
 -1.1397  0.0766  1.3821 -0.4036
[torch.FloatTensor of size 1x1x4]

In [7]: torch.cat((a, torch.zeros(a.size())))
Out[7]:

(0 ,.,.) =
 -1.1397  0.0766  1.3821 -0.4036

(1 ,.,.) =
  0.0000  0.0000  0.0000  0.0000
[torch.FloatTensor of size 2x1x4]
```

What's wrong?

Cheers,
Alessandro
